summary: This is an FBI Task Force Officer's affidavit in support of a search warrant application for six binders with CDs (Subject Items -1 and -2). The affidavit details the ongoing investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking conspiracy, the evidence seized from his New York residence, and the need to search additional media that was removed from the residence after initial searches. It includes references to multiple prior search warrants, victim and witness interviews, and the discovery of thousands of images of nude/suggestive young females.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary defendant, charged with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors. The affidavit details his alleged abuse of dozens of minor girls from 2002-2005 at his New York and Florida residences, his payment to victims, and his death in custody in August 2019.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as a Target Subject and co-conspirator. The affidavit states bank records show Epstein wired $250,000 to her in December 2018, suggesting an attempt to influence her as allegations re-emerged. She is identified as facilitating Epstein's abuse.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: Signed the initial search warrants for the New York residence on July 6 and July 7, 2019, and the warrant for the Seized Discs on July 7, 2019.

persons.name: Henry B. Pitman
persons.context: Signed the Fourth Warrant on July 11, 2019, authorizing seizure of all electronic devices and storage media in the New York residence.

persons.name: Kevin Nathaniel Fox
persons.context: Signed the Fifth Warrant on July 15, 2019, authorizing search of items from the blue and black suitcases.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: Signed the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein that is attached as Exhibit A to the affidavit.

persons.name: Victim-1
persons.context: A victim interviewed by the FBI who stated Epstein sexually abused her multiple times between 2002-2005 when she was under 18 at the New York residence. She has disclosed past marriage fraud, substance abuse, and work at a massage parlor. Her information has been corroborated.

persons.name: Individual-1
persons.context: A young girl identified in partially-nude photographs from the seized discs. Interviewed in July/August 2019, she stated she met Epstein in 2003 at age 17, traveled to his properties, was sexually abused and raped by him before turning 18, and was photographed by Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Employee-1
persons.context: A New York-based employee of Epstein identified in the indictment who facilitated abuse by contacting victims to schedule sexual encounters.

persons.name: Employee-2
persons.context: An assistant of Epstein identified in the indictment who facilitated abuse by scheduling encounters with minor victims in Florida. Identified as a Target Subject of the ongoing investigation.

persons.name: Employee-3
persons.context: An assistant of Epstein identified in the indictment who facilitated abuse by scheduling encounters with minor victims.

persons.name: Minor Victim-1
persons.context: Identified in the indictment as a minor victim recruited in 2002, repeatedly abused by Epstein in New York, paid hundreds per encounter, and encouraged to recruit other girls. She told Epstein her age.

persons.name: Minor Victim-2
persons.context: Identified in the indictment as a minor victim recruited in 2004, repeatedly abused by Epstein in Florida, paid hundreds per encounter, and encouraged to recruit other girls.

persons.name: Minor Victim-3
persons.context: Identified in the indictment as a minor victim recruited in 2005, repeatedly abused by Epstein in Florida, paid hundreds per encounter, and encouraged to recruit other girls. She told Epstein her age.

connections.description: Maxwell is identified as a known co-conspirator and Target Subject. Epstein wired her $250,000 in December 2018, which the affidavit suggests was an attempt to influence her as allegations re-emerged.
Employee-1 worked for Epstein in New York and facilitated his abuse by contacting victims to schedule sexual encounters, as per the indictment.
Employee-2 worked for Epstein as an assistant and facilitated his abuse by scheduling encounters with minor victims in Florida, including while both were in New York. Identified as a Target Subject.
Employee-3 worked for Epstein as an assistant and facilitated his abuse by scheduling encounters with minor victims.
Individual-1 states she met Epstein at 17, he paid for her travel to his properties, and he sexually abused and raped her on multiple occasions before she turned 18.
Individual-1 reported that Maxwell asked to photograph her when she was approximately 17, and did photograph her.
Victim-1 stated Epstein sexually abused her on multiple occasions between 2002-2005 when she was under 18 at the New York residence.

events.title: Epstein Indictment
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Jeffrey Epstein with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors.

events.title: Epstein Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested pursuant to the indictment and detained at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.

events.title: Epstein Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the MCC and pronounced dead.

events.title: First Search of NY Residence
events.description: Law enforcement executed the first search warrant at Epstein's New York residence (9 East 71st St). The search was paused and the scene frozen.

events.title: Second Search of NY Residence
events.description: Law enforcement executed a second, more specific warrant at the NY residence, seizing numerous CDs, binders of photographs, and other items including a 'PB Girls' binder, nude Polaroids, and a folder marked with a victim's initials.

events.title: Removal and Recovery of Evidence
events.description: After a fourth warrant was issued, law enforcement found a safe empty. An employee stated they were instructed by a Third Party to remove the safe's contents and deliver them in two suitcases. The Third Party returned the suitcases, which contained the Subject Items (binders with CDs).

events.title: Miami Herald Series Published
events.description: The Miami Herald began publishing a series of articles about Epstein's sexual misconduct with minors and the prior Florida investigation, including information about Ghislaine Maxwell's role.

events.title: $250k Wire to Maxwell
events.description: Bank records show Epstein wired $250,000 from a trust account to Ghislaine Maxwell, days after the Miami Herald series began.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse
events.description: The indictment alleges Epstein sexually exploited and abused dozens of minor girls at his New York and Florida residences during this period, using a network of victims and recruiters.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Zorro Ranch (Epstein's property in New Mexico)
Little Saint James (Epstein's property in the U.S. Virgin Islands)
Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York
keyFacts: The affidavit seeks a warrant to search six binders with CDs that were removed from Epstein's New York safe after initial searches and later recovered from suitcases delivered by a Third Party.

Previous searches of Epstein's NY home revealed thousands of nude/partially nude photographs of young females on CDs, many labeled with female names, 'nudes', 'Zorro', 'LSJ', and some appearing to depict girls under 18.
One victim (Individual-1) identified in the photos stated she was 17 when Epstein sexually abused and raped her on multiple occasions and that Ghislaine Maxwell photographed her.
The investigation remained ongoing after Epstein's death, focusing on co-conspirators including Ghislaine Maxwell and Employee-2.
The affidavit notes a $250,000 wire from Epstein to Maxwell in December 2018, suggesting an attempt to influence her as allegations resurfaced.
